intro: Caiophora mollis, commonly known as the soft caiophora, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests or undergrowth. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
